text: The AI service mesh demo runs on a two-node Proxmox cluster and ports cleanly to AWS EKS. It showcases traffic splitting, autoscaling, and observability across FastAPI services.
Linkerd provides mTLS and traffic splitting via the Gateway API. Canary traffic is routed with HTTPRoute backends and weights.
Horizontal Pod Autoscaling uses CPU utilization to scale services. The demo shows scale-up under load and scale-down once metrics drop.
Prometheus scrapes metrics and Grafana visualizes request latency, error rate, and replica counts for the demo services.
The same Helm chart deploys to EKS by swapping values for ingress and storage classes, keeping workloads consistent across environments.
The system includes embedding, classifier, eval, LLM, and vision services. The gateway orchestrates these services for end-to-end workflows.
